events.event_name: Release of German Industrial Output Data (December 2025)
events.description: The official release of Germany's industrial production figures for the month of December 2025.

facts.fact_text: Germany’s industrial output declined by 1.9% month-on-month in December 2025.

evidences.evidence_text: Germany’s industrial output declined by 1.9% month-on-month in December 2025

facts.fact_text: The automotive industry experienced an 8.9% decline in output.

evidences.evidence_text: The automotive industry (-8.9%) led the decline

facts.fact_text: Industrial activity from October to December was 0.9% higher than the previous three months.

evidences.evidence_text: In the less volatile three-month comparison, activity from October to December was 0.9% higher than in the previous three months.

facts.fact_text: The construction sector saw a 3% increase in output.

claims.claim_text: The 1.9% decline in industrial output was worse than market expectations.

evidences.evidence_text: worse than market expectations of a 0.3% fall

claims.claim_text: Lower output in capital goods and intermediate goods dragged down the overall industrial production.

evidences.evidence_text: industrial production dropped 3%, dragged by lower output in capital goods (-5.3%) and intermediate goods (-1.2%)

evidence.evidence_text: The automotive industry (-8.9%) led the decline
Germany’s industrial output declined by 1.9% month-on-month in December 2025
These declines were partially offset by gains in... the construction sector (+3%)
industrial production dropped 3%, dragged by lower output in capital goods (-5.3%)
